really being dismissed and talked at but

made me wanna take a stand against

and some of those girls I live in here
in England some of the key challenges as
an activist and were working to end FGM
has been the misconceptions and for a
long time everybody assumed FGM was some
kind of cultural thing that happened
through ignorance as opposed to an
organized crime against women I would
say to the next generation of female
activists be brave use your voice
never underestimate what you can achieve
believe in your own voice and ultimately
that there's somebody out there that
agrees with you there is no such thing
as an original idea there's probably
someone else who's just as angry and as
upset about the things that you're upset
about so do em sort of do your research
and find other women to really stand in
solidarity with women always have to

the fight for themselves and that's
that's true but don't disconnect

but actually together when we raise our
voices together and we're loud we can be

proverb that I love and it's like if you
want to go fast go alone if you want to
go far go together and I do think
